channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says she won't seek reelection
item.description: The 85-year-old California Democrat's departure will mark the end of an era in Congress. In 2007, Pelosi became the first woman elected to serve as U.S. House speaker.
item.content:encoded: The 85-year-old California Democrat's departure will mark the end of an era in Congress. In 2007, Pelosi became the first woman elected to serve as U.S. House speaker.
item.dc:creator: Scott Shafer

item.title: Democrats' big wins send mixed signals to Senate on how to end the shutdown
item.description: Democrats won big in key elections this week. But rather than provide clarity, those victories have sent competing signals to lawmakers in the Senate about how to end the ongoing government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: Democrats won big in key elections this week. But rather than provide clarity, those victories have sent competing signals to lawmakers in the Senate about how to end the ongoing government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Rep. Jeff Hurd, R-Colo., talks about a bipartisan proposal to end the shutdown
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to Republican Congressman Jeff Hurd of Colorado about his work on a bipartisan "statement of principles" to extend subsidies for Obamacare and end the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to Republican Congressman Jeff Hurd of Colorado about his work on a bipartisan "statement of principles" to extend subsidies for Obamacare and end the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: How would the government shutdown affect Thanksgiving travel? Here's what to know
item.description: Holiday travel can already be stressful. Here's how a prolonged government shutdown might make things even harder and whether you should travel at all.
item.content:encoded:
Holiday travel can already be stressful. Here's how a prolonged government shutdown might make things even harder and whether you should travel at all.

(Image credit: Silvio Avila)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Is your electric bill going up? AI is partly to blame
item.description: Across the country, demand for electricity is on the rise — and so is the price of electric power.
item.content:encoded:
Across the country, demand for electricity is on the rise — and so is the price of electric power.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Democrats' victories complicate Senate shutdown talks, SCOTUS seems skeptical of Trump's authority to impose tariffs, judges hear cases on Chicago ICE detention center and agents' use of force.
item.content:encoded: Democrats' victories complicate Senate shutdown talks, SCOTUS seems skeptical of Trump's authority to impose tariffs, judges hear cases on Chicago ICE detention center and agents' use of force.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Your credit history could be costing you more to drive
item.description: Auto insurance companies often use credit history as a factor in setting premiums
item.content:encoded:
Auto insurance companies often use credit history as a factor in setting premiums

(Image credit: Sofia Valiente for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Robert Benincasa

item.title: NPR returns to Gaza for sobering post-war tour
item.description: NPR's Daniel Estrin visits Gaza for the first time since the war began, touring the destruction in northern Gaza.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Daniel Estrin visits Gaza for the first time since the war began, touring the destruction in northern Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Billionaires who spent millions to block him now face working with NYC's new mayor
item.description: Wall Street leaders and billionaires spent big to defeat democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani in New York City's mayoral race. Now they have to figure out how to work with him.
item.content:encoded: Wall Street leaders and billionaires spent big to defeat democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani in New York City's mayoral race. Now they have to figure out how to work with him.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: With social safety nets cut, Americans in rural areas look for ways to cope
item.description: Millions of Americans rely on federal subsidies and programs to make ends meet. But the shutdown and other cuts have them looking elsewhere for help. Here's how residents in rural New York are coping.
item.content:encoded: Millions of Americans rely on federal subsidies and programs to make ends meet. But the shutdown and other cuts have them looking elsewhere for help. Here's how residents in rural New York are coping.
item.dc:creator: Emily Russell
